title: Florentin Pogba has squad numbers shaved into hair to mark 'magical' clash with brother Paul
text:
Football Florentin Pogba has squad numbers shaved into hair to mark 'magical' clash with brother Paul Florentin Pogba has got himself a commemorative hairstyle for the Europa League clash against his brother, Paul Credit: Martin Rickett/PA Sean Gibson 15 February 2017 â€¢ 7:18pm 
S aint-Etienne's Florentin Pogba has plumped for an unusual hairstyle choice to commemorate his meeting with brother Paul in Thursday's night's Europa League clash with Manchester United. 
The elder Pogba has shaved both his and his brother's squad numbers into the sides of his head in the week of Les Verts ' trip to Old Trafford. 
Paul, the younger and more famous of the two brothers, has himself become as notorious for his flamboyant hairstyles as for his footballing ability and world-record breaking transfer fee . It remains to be seen if he will pull anything special out of the hat (so to speak) for this first competitive meeting with his sibling. 
Florentin's snazzy new haircut comes on the same day it was revealed that former Sunderland forward Asamoah Gyan is on a list of 47 players in the United Arab Emirates deemed to be sporting "unethical hairstyles" . 
The Saint-Etienne midfielder, 26, has spoken of his excitement ahead of the Europa League knockout stages and expects the tie to be "a magical moment" for the two Pogbas. Paul, not Florentin (pictured), is usually the Pogba whose hair makes the headlines Credit: Martin Rickett/PA Paul Pogba: every crazy haircut 
"The 19 is my squad number and the six is for him," Florentin said on Wednesday. "I hope he and I enjoy it the best we can. 
"Mum's going to be here. Obviously these things don't happen very often in a player's career, the chance to see her two sons playing against each other. She can't lose really, can she?" Florentin Pogba has confirmed his mum will be present at both legs of St Etienne's Europa League clash with Manchester United Credit: Martin Rickett/PA 
F lorentin added that the pair had not had much contact since the draw for the knockout stages pitted the brothers against one another. 
"We've given each other some stick and there was some banter straight after the draw was made, but since then we've been so focused on our respective league games." 
A third Pogba brother - Mathias , Florentin's twin - currently plays for Sparta Rotterdam in the Netherlands. He lived with Paul during the latter's previous spell at Man Utd, while Mathias played for Wrexham.
